headline: University of Phoenix owner eyes $1.2 billion valuation in US IPO
summary: Existing stockholders of Phoenix Education Partners are seeking up to $140.3 million by offering 4.25 million shares priced between $31 and $33 apiece.  Private capital firm Apollo Global is selling 3.55 million shares, while investment firm Vistria Group is offloading 0.7 million shares.  The IPO pickup has lately broadened out to private equity deals, with a steady stream of sponsor-backed companies hitting the new listings market in recent months.
